Reviews.Title: “a clean and comfortable hotel in a great location for sightseeing via metro, out of the hussle and bussle”
Reviews.Author: Rottentroll
Reviews.Content: A great stay. The hotel and room was very clean and comfortable. The cleaners did a brill job tidying the room, each day was as if it was the first day we'd arrived. Nice bathroom with good sized and quality shower. Staff friendly and helpful. The breakfast had a great range - cereal, toast, cake, coissant, fruit, yoghurt. No kettle in the room, but a vending machine in recpetion which sold drinks including water and some snacks at a very reasonable price to set you up for a days sightseeing. Also computer and printer available to use in reception. The location of this hotel was brilliant for our sightseeing. It is located near to the end of Diagonal, you can see the Teatre Nacional de Catalunya from the hotel. The best thing is it is 5mins walk from the metro station Glories. We found travelling around Barcelona so easy on the metro. A T10 ticket suited us, you have 10 rides (one ride includes changes so until you resurface) and it cost under 10euros, so this is less than 1euro per ride. So cheap to get around and its quick and easy to do! The hotel is in a fab situation for visiting up (Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell) across (Casa Mila and Casa Batllo, La Rambla) down (beach). If you want to stay out of the hussle and bussle of La Rambla, the hotel felt like it was in a calm and safe neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Evijaab
Reviews.Content: Was in Barcelona between Christmas and New Year 2009. Found the hotel at booking.com but booked at hotel's home page finally, it was cheaper. Took BB basis, good choise for busy travelers who dont want to think about where to eat breakfast. Flight was late at the arrival day and we had to take a taxy, 45 eur. Quite expencive. The same on departure morning when had to be at airport at 07h00. almost 100 euro for airport transfers. Quite a lot. Good points : room was good and spacious, well renovated, bathroom good. Breakfast room very light and had quite good choise : different breads, some salad, spanish omlet, even some sausages, different fruits and juices. Very helpfull staff, only good about them, especially the elderly night shift receptionist, super helpfull! Not very central location, around 15-20 minutes tu Ciutadella Park and the same to bid shopping mall - the "egg" tower. Can recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's all...”
Reviews.Author: samisGR
Reviews.Content: New hotel, in a good location, in a nice safe area 10 minutes walk from 2 metro stations and 15-20 walk from Sagrada Familia, but that's all.... Definitely not a 4 star hotel but much less!! Although we had booked for a double room they gave us a 3-bed because we asked for a smoking room. It had one double bed and one single and i really feel sorry for whoever is going to sleep in the single bed... the room was very small, the closet barely for one person. The bathroom was nice and big but the only place in the shower to put a shampoo was down... no refrigerator, change of sheets and towels every 3 days and very intimate with the neighbours since you can hear everything! In the lobby nothing but the reception and the restaurant in the basement. I doubt that there was even room service although we didn't ask anything, since there was just a phone with no further instructions... In the plus was that the hotel's staff was quite friendly and everybody was speaking English.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: derks22
Reviews.Content: didn't like the space in between the bed and the cigaret smell when we entered the room ( smell disappear after a half day ) staff was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Simply and modern”
Reviews.Author: JanBZ
Reviews.Content: For 4 nights at the end of octomber , the hotel was a good enough choice. I think is a little bit expensive . The room was no so large for a three beds, there was a single chair and a little table in the room (for 3 pers.). I didn’t like the glass door at the bathroom and the noise through the walls. Fortunately we lerned italian language just one night. The beds were OK , probably they’re changed (other reviewers claims the bed). The breakfast was very good ,especially for the “jamon”. The very plus was the receptionists , I think the very few persons that speak english and smile in Barcelona. The hotel is in a quiet area, three metro stops at max 10 min away, a Condis supermarket just at the street corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: elle-ce
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the hotel for 3 nights for my birthday. We had a pleasant stay despite the very very uncomfortable beds - I am not a fussy person but I felt that the mattress was going to cave in ever time I sat on it. The location is great and safe, we used the metro to go to most places, there are two stops very close by (monumental and glores). The sagrada familia is very close, within walking distance. The breakfast was nice, the usual continental breakfast - no fireworks but a good healthy breakfast no the less. There is free wi fi in the reception or you can use the computer which I think it was 1euro for 5minutes. The staff are also quite friendly and speak a good amount of english. Overall would reccommend but if you like a comfortable bed this hotel probubly isnt for you. - Also the walls are quite thin, was woken up every morning by a couple in the room next to us.

Reviews.Title: “Newer hotel with Ikea furnishings”
Reviews.Author: SavvyDesigner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in September. The cost per night was actually pretty high, it averaged at about $225/nt. which I think is way too expensive for the quality and location. The hotel is a bit far from all the main attractions, city center, and the metro is about a 5-7 minute unpleasant walk. It is directly adjacent to the theatre so I thought that there would be at least some nightlife or activity around. But there is nothing nearby, not much restaurants, and the markets nearby seem to open at will. I guess that is why they provide free breakfast at the hotel. They also provide free wifi, but it expires every 24 hrs of use, so we had to ask the front desk every night for the new password. The hotel is a new remodel, so there is not a lot of wear and tear. However they cheaped out on the building material. The walls are paper thin and you can hear the adjacent room clearly. The passthrough door between rooms are also not the most secure. The locks are flimsy and the doors are low quality and they seem like you could very easiiy kick through them. The rooms are pretty spacious for Europe. The bed was very uncomfortable and I could feel every spring in the mattress. The mattress was thin and there is no box spring. It felt like I was sleeping on someone's foldout sofabed. All the furniture and accessories came from ikea. There is a glass writing desk near the window with a desk chair. As a small functional desk, it served its purpose, but be careful of those sharp chipped edges, kinda dangerous for the careless. There is a fold out plastic chair in the closet if you wish to put out another chair. There are no safes in the rooms which is a little annoying because who in their right mind would carry their valuables with them in Barcelona? So we decided to opt out of room cleaning for the 4 nights so that the maid won't come in and rummage through our things. Overall, I think the location was a bad choice. I would advise others to spend a little more money and stay closer to the city center, dining out was always a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in OK location”
Reviews.Author: nicomorix
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a quite good location, not very central, but not too far (but not too close) to 2 metro stations and at a walking distance (15 mins) from Sagrada Familia. The personnel was friendly and the room had a nice view on Bofil's theatre and on Jean Nouvel's building. The room were very clean, silent and confortable. The worse thing was the internet connection. The wireless was only available at the entrance of the room and sometimes close to the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: Graziella5b
Reviews.Content: It is located a little off the place you would like to be. We chose it to because it is a block away from our friend's flat. Most likely you 'll need to take a taxi or bus here and there, for a short drive. It is an older building totally remodeled as a new minimalist , modern hotel. However I agree with a former report that the mattress should be changed, not terrible, but could be better. The rooms are a little crazy, ours and most of them are the same, had a very nice modern, big bathroom, but the sleeping area was enough only to put the twin beds in it, the TV Screen had to be hanging from the wall. The floors are nice: floating parquet, the bed covers are white and it gives a good feeling of cleanses. HOwever I noticed that the maids, not Spanish born did not clean as good as most Spanish women do. A notch behind.It seems to me that the housekeeping fails by not checking enough. The bathroom and sleeping area are glued together by corridors, which makes the whole "room"a little unusual. The breakfast was nice, and they have a nice touch, no matter at what time you leave they manage to give you a juice, a coffee and a croissant or brioche . Very nice. This hotel belongs to the SM Hotels and follows the policy of changing constantly the rates for each single day, so I found myself with a reservation with higher rates than the one offered two weeks later. I cancelled and reserved again, but it left a bitter taste. Had I wished to pre paid the price would have been a little better, but I like to keep my options open and never pre pay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but not if you need to nap during day”
Reviews.Author: kath3kids
Reviews.Content: Great location-close to sagrada familia Had a migraine on day 2 There is a basketball club right outside winked in back. One team blew airborne and chanted whole game But Staff couldn't have been better Promptly addressed call for air conditioner Checkedon me brought tea and made themselves available throughout stay Wonderful caring people Clean hotel breakfast delicious and pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, well-priced hotel but with old beds”
Reviews.Author: geert21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to two subway stations (5 minutes walk) and the Sagrada Familia (10minutes walk). Therefore the city centre is reachable in 15 minutes. The area around it is safe and quiet, though not abonded because of the presence of the National Theatre and Auditori (Classic Concert Hall). The hotel itself is modern and small to medium sized. Our room was very clean and the bathroom is spacious and comfortable. The view on the backside of the hotel is on a communal yard, but not worth noting when you aren't in your hotel the whole day. The only negative aspect about the room was the bed which felt like it was time to be replaced. The breakfast was worth its price with croissants, muffins, bread, different kind of meat and cheese, fresh orange/multifruit juice, coffee, tea, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: Iowayankee20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to the subway and was in a well lit and safe area of town. The staff at the desk were very helpful and happy to give directions and recommendations. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The breakfast was very good- included muffins, bagels, fruit, cereal, coffee, and juice. It was one of the best hotels we stayed in while touring Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place, you'll regret this one”
Reviews.Author: ldervish
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I based my choice partly on tripadvisor reviews, which mostly rave about the BW del Teatre Auditori. How I wish I had paid more attention to the others! While the location is convenient (i.e. within a few blocks) of several Metro stops and a couple major attractions like the theatre and the Monumental bullfight arena, it is in the middle of a short block and over a mile from Las Ramblas and quite a distance from Sagrada Familiia. The rooms are tiny and odd-shaped, and the flat panel tv is 6 feet up on the wall and all of 19" on the diagonal. That's right, just slightly bigger than your laptop. That's ok though, because the 2 feet or so of space beside the pushed together twin beds will have you screaming if you are claustrophobic, and shaking your head if you are not. Look at the pictures closely, because what they show you is all there is to show. Sleep on the 5th floor was generally good except for when the band practiced in the building next door, or when school was in session (also next door). The bathroom was "different" with a sliding glass door but ok; there was no tub and the shower closed via two sliding glass doors that formed one corner. Housekeeping was decent but stingy with soap and toilet paper. The breakfast is continental and basic, consisting of croissants and a few other loaf type breads, fruit, yogurt, juice and milk. The coffee, a decently flavored espresso sort of brew, is brought out individually like it is rationed. There were also slices of one ham-type deli meat and one cheese , and 3 kinds of bulk cereal (not individually packaged). All for 9 Euros ($11) per person per day. And if you think the breadfast is included with your stay as we did, you had better ask up front so you won't be surprised with the bill at checkout, as we were, when the reservation did not match what we had been told our package included. Most of the staff tried to be helpful, but they are not truly multi-lingual and struggle to understand and answer even basic questions. One day-time staffer was downright rude. The hotel does not cash traveler's checks, the "safe deposit" is the room behind the front desk, and the internet access is a single computer by the front desk. As in, two steps from the front desk, where they can keep an eye on what you are doing. This hotel is S-M-A-L-L. Lobby furniture consists of 2 loveseats and a chair. I also did not like them calling across the lobby to ask our room number as we were leaving the building, sometimes while other clients were lounging or being helped by the desk staff - it's generally not a good idea to advertise that you're not in your room. I wish I could give you an alternative hotel in Barcelona, but we traveled to Valencia and stayed at the spectacular Westin there. Night and day from this hotel, and we were so glad the better hotel was second. The best thing they did for us at the BW del TA was call the taxi when our three day stay was up.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay close to everything”
Reviews.Author: ALENA_KHV
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice place to stay - very quite and close to everything - abt 10-15 min walk to Sagrada Familia, abt 25 min walk to Plaza Catalunya & the same time or even less to the seaside, very close to public transportation (metro, train & bus stations are within max.10 min walk) when u become lazy to walk. the rooms are clean & everything looks like it is new - actually the cab driver told us that the hotel is new & it looks like it, wifi worked all the time of our stay there, but the only one thing is that soundproof is nt that good - we could hear our neighbours sometimes:) the staff is very helpful with everything. it think we'll stay there again next time. there is nice restaurant 5 min walk from the hotel - I 4got its name, but service and food there are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Goeleta
Reviews.Content: Hi, We have visited wonderful Barcelona for a week in late January 2010 and were very pleased with this hidden, quiet place to stay that exceeded all our expectations. The hotel looks new (has either been completely refurbished a year prior to our arrival or it was brand new), the rooms are nice, very clean, with new bedroom and bathroom appliances. Because of its location on a quiet street (Calle Ribes), we were able to get rested very well, which was one of our most important aspects in selecting it in the first place. The rooms located towards the front side of the building seem to be the more quieter. According to the web site, the BW Del Teatre Auditory hotel is located in the Eixample area, close to “Barcelona Nord” Bus Station (Girona Airport Bus Stop). For us that was a perfect location, which is close enough to the Sagrada Familia Cathedral, the Ramblas and to the public transportation system, as well as to other points of interest, including the Teatre Auditori (right behind the hotel). There is a bus station on its street (c. Ribes) and the Glories Subway station is only 5-7 minutes away walking, which also makes the hotel very easily reachable from the airport without taking the taxi (by train to Clot, then back one stop to Glories, by subway). Walking to city center (Placa Catalunya/ La Rambla) takes 30-40 minutes (or 3-4 metro stops away from Glories), and half that time to the Sagrada Familia. If one has the Barcelona card, which gives unlimited access to the public transportation system, it would take less than 20 minutes to reach the city center. The subway is running 24h/24h on weekends. The special room price available on BestWestern.com was very good at €59/night which included a buffet breakfast for two (normally 9€/pers), great for saving time in the morning, since we would have otherwise spent approximately 15-20 minutes to reach an outside restaurant from the hotel. The food was good and included a large enough selection of choices (several types of cereal and yogurt, milk, various fruit juices, fruits, hams, croissants, cheeses, jams, honey, coffee and tea, bread/toast etc.). The rooms are medium size, with comfortable, clean beds, LCD TVs, A/C, a closet and large windows that could be opened for fresh air. The bathroom was very clean, modern and stuffed with everything normally needed. There is a computer connected to high-speed internet in the lobby, free to use for all guests. There is no safe in the room, but one could leave valuables sealed in an envelope and locked in the main safe at the office, which is guaranteed and worked for us. Last, but not at all the least, we were pleasantly surprised with the friendliness of all the staff during our entire stay. They were very nice, eager to help and accommodated all our requests (thank you!). We received from them valuable information about the city, country and its culture as well as information on restaurants, site seeing, transportation, cultural events, tips. They eagerly helped with our special meal requests and on the day of arrival we received a room with a double bed at no extra charge. Overall, we consider that the Best Western Del Teatre Auditory hotel and its staff fully deserved an 'excellent' rating for a 3-4 star hotel. It was a very nice trip and we would stay at this location again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MissK83
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel, it was clean and modern and the staff were friendly and couldn't do enough to help you. The bathroom was lovely and spacious with a wonderful shower and the beds were very comfortable. The location is great for a budget hotel, we walked into central Barcelona in about 15/20 minutes but it's also very near a Metro station. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: crosslover
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights here..very clean boutique hotel with buffet breakfast...breakfast choices somewhat limited...room is somewhat small, very clean, very modern furnishings..the hotel location is very good...3 subway stops and 2 light rail stops within 5 minutes walk..also a large shopping center with carrefour and numerous dining options a 5 minute walk away..all in all a very pleasant hotel with a helpful staff..would definitely stay again. Also had free internet in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cheap, not much else”
Reviews.Author: happyfeet54
Reviews.Content: Google maps can be confusing, this hotel is literally across the street from the Teatro. It's walking distance to the Marina, Monumental, and Glories metros. Since the hotel is so new, late 2008/early 2009, the rooms are clean and comfortable. No ick factor. It's also quiet which is a plus. The location isn't spectacular but we were on a budget and the price couldn't be beat. Marina metro is at most a 10 minute walk away and is two stops from Plaza Cataluyna. It's also very close to Sagrada Familia, maybe a brisk 15 min walk. Why the low service rating? Well, there's no in room safe contrary to what the website says. The in room wi-fi doesn't work. The desk staff is very friendly but not that helpful. They don't know too much about the neighborhood and some of them, the younger ones, would rather spend time chatting online with their friends than to spend time helping you look something up or to notice people strolling into the hotel and up the elevators. I would stay there again if my budget is still a concern.
